messages.title: Why Ludlow constituency needs a change of Government
messages.content: Since becoming your local MP I have tried to make myself as available as possible to help local residents address the issues they care about most. But we need a change of Government to get the country back on its feet and Ludlow's neglected voice heard. Now we need to change the Labour Government that has overseen the neglect of the countryside and vote Conservative at the next General Election. Only by voting Conservative can we only hope to deliver a more effective, stronger voice for Ludlow in Parliament, and begin repairing the damage to the fabric of our community.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Plans for affordable local housing for local people, ending the neglect.
Stop wasteful buildings by schools. Improve our education.
Support green energy initiatives such as Bishop's Castle 'Household Energy Service', which promotes energy conservation and reduction in carbon emission.

issues.environment: Supporting green energy initiatives across the constituency, promoting energy conservation and reduction in carbon emission.

housing.content: Conservative plans for affordable local housing will allow local people to get homes. Ending to local neglect.

politicalExperience.achievements: Working with local communities and businesses, improving schools, planning for local housing, supporting green energy initiatives.

contactInformation.address: Ludlow Conservative Association, 54 Broad Street, Ludlow, Shropshire, SY8 1GP
